summary: The 'Ensuring Lasting Smiles Act' (H.R. 3277) mandates health insurance coverage for outpatient and inpatient services related to the diagnosis and treatment of congenital anomalies and birth defects impacting the eyes, ears, teeth, mouth, or jaw. This includes reconstructive services, adjunctive support, and services for secondary conditions. It amends the Public Health Service Act, ERISA, and the Internal Revenue Code. The bill also requires notice to beneficiaries and a study on network adequacy. The provisions become effective for plan years starting January 1, 2026.
